fluxible 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    assessing quality of slopes calculated

    flux_quality.Rd

    indicates if fluxes should be discarded or replaced by 0 according to parameters set by user

    Usage

    flux_quality(
  slopes_df,
  fit_type,
  ambient_conc = 421,
  error = 100,
  fluxID_col = "f_fluxID",
  slope_col = "f_slope",
  weird_fluxesID = c(),
  pvalue_col = "f_pvalue",
  rsquared_col = "f_rsquared",
  pvalue_threshold = 0.3,
  rsquared_threshold = 0.7,
  conc_col = "f_conc",
  b_col = "f_b",
  time_col = "f_time",
  fit_col = "f_fit",
  cut_col = "f_cut",
  RMSE_threshold = 25,
  cor_threshold = 0.5,
  b_threshold = 1
)

    Arguments

    slopes_df

    dataset containing slopes

    fit_type

    expression used to fit the data, linear or exponential

    ambient_conc

    ambient gas concentration in ppm at the site of measurement (used to detect measurement that started with a polluted setup)

    error

    error of the setup, defines a window in which the starting values are considered acceptable

    fluxID_col

    column containing unique IDs for each flux

    slope_col

    column containing the slope of each flux (as calculated by the flux_fitting function)

    weird_fluxesID

    vector of fluxIDs that should be discarded by the user's decision

    pvalue_col

    column containing the p-value of each flux (linear fit)

    rsquared_col

    column containing the r squared to be used for the quality assessment (linear fit)

    pvalue_threshold

    threshold of p-value below which the change of gas concentration over time is considered not significant (linear fit)

    rsquared_threshold

    threshold of r squared value below which the linear model is considered an unsatisfactory fit (linear fit)

    conc_col

    column containing the measured gas concentration (exponential fit)

    b_col

    column containing the b parameter of the exponential expression (exponential fit)

    time_col

    column containing the time of each measurement in seconds (exponential fit)

    fit_col

    column containing the modeled data (exponential fit)

    cut_col

    column containing the cutting information

    RMSE_threshold

    threshold for the RMSE of each flux above which the fit is considered unsatisfactory (exponential fit)

    cor_threshold

    threshold for the correlation coefficient of gas concentration with time below which the correlation is considered non significant (exponential fit)

    b_threshold

    threshold for the b parameter. Defines a window with its opposite inside which the fit is considered good enough (exponential fit)

    Value

    same dataframe with added flag and corrected slopes columns

    Examples

    data(slopes0lin)
flux_quality(slopes0lin, fit_type = "li")
#> # A tibble: 1,251 × 24
